column4: I want to mount my Windows partition (dual boot) and make it available to all my users. Will this line in fstab do the trick? :  /dev/hdaX  /media/hdd  nts  user  0 2
user lets any user mount it
if you just want to let users read/write to it whilst having it mounted at startup, umask=0
umask=0 ? Where ?
in the options column
/dev/hdaX               /mnt/winnt              ntfs    umask=0,ro      0 0
something like that, for instance.
except you'll want 'auto' in there too
What do 'auto' do ? Auto mount ?
indeed
at the CLI, type 'man mount', and when that's loaded type '/-o mount' and hit enter
those are all for the mount command, but they (I think) all work in the options field for fstab.
thanks, njan
